001package io.github.ai4ci.flow.builders;
002
003import io.github.ai4ci.abm.Calibration;
004import io.github.ai4ci.abm.ImmutableOutbreakBaseline;
005import io.github.ai4ci.abm.Outbreak;
006import io.github.ai4ci.config.execution.ExecutionConfiguration;
007import io.github.ai4ci.config.inhost.InHostConfiguration;
008import io.github.ai4ci.util.Sampler;
009
010/**
011 * Default logic for producing an {@link ImmutableOutbreakBaseline} from an
012 * {@link Outbreak} and execution configuration.
013 *
014 * <p>
015 * This interface provides a small, focussed default implementation of outbreak
016 * baselining that computes outbreak level aggregates and model calibration
017 * parameters. It is intended to be composed into higher level builders such as
018 * {@link io.github.ai4ci.flow.builders.DefaultModelBuilder} where composition
019 * keeps responsibilities separated and makes it easy to swap alternative
020 * baseline strategies.
021 *
022 * <p>
023 * Composition with {@link io.github.ai4ci.flow.builders.DefaultModelBuilder}:
024 * {@code DefaultModelBuilder} implements this interface and delegates to the
025 * default implementation defined here via
026 * {@code DefaultOutbreakBaseliner.super.baselineOutbreak(...)}. This makes the
027 * wiring explicit: callers can use {@code DefaultModelBuilder} as a ready‑made
028 * builder or substitute alternative baseliner logic by implementing this
029 * interface differently or by subclassing the model builder and overriding the
030 * delegation point.
031 *
032 * <p>
033 * Rationale: keeping outbreak baselining as a composable default makes the
034 * codebase easier to extend and test. The default implementation performs
035 * common tasks such as inferring a viral load transmissibility parameter,
036 * computing expected contacts per person, deriving severity cutoffs from the
037 * configured in‑host model and building an infectivity profile.
038 *
039 * <p>
040 * Downstream uses: the returned {@code ImmutableOutbreakBaseline} is used by
041 * the initialisation stage of the simulation and by runtime components that
042 * need global priors (for example transmission scaling, default policy state
043 * and severity thresholds). See
044 * {@link io.github.ai4ci.flow.builders.DefaultModelBuilder} for an example of
045 * how this interface is composed into the concrete model builder.
046 *
047 * @author Rob Challen
048 */
049public interface DefaultOutbreakBaseliner {
050
051        /**
052         * Produce an outbreak baseline from the supplied outbreak and execution
053         * configuration.
054         *
055         * <p>
056         * This default implementation performs the following key steps:
057         * <ol>
058         * <li>Obtain the {@link ExecutionConfiguration} from the outbreak.</li>
059         * <li>Attempt a fast inference of the viral load transmissibility parameter
060         * with a fallback to a more robust method on failure.</li>
061         * <li>Compute expected contacts per person using {@link Calibration}.</li>
062         * <li>Derive severity cutoffs by consulting the configured
063         * {@link InHostConfiguration}.</li>
064         * <li>Construct an infectivity profile using
065         * {@link InHostConfiguration#getInfectivityProfile}.</li>
066         * <li>Set a conservative symptom duration from the configured severity
067         * profile quantile.</li>
068         * </ol>
069         *
070         * <p>
071         * Composition notes: when this method is composed into
072         * {@link io.github.ai4ci.flow.builders.DefaultModelBuilder} the builder
073         * delegates to the default implementation shown here. Implementers that
074         * provide an alternative baseliner should preserve the expectation that
075         * people have already been baselined and avoid performing heavy IO or long
076         * running work inside this method unless the calling builder is specifically
077         * designed to parallelise or manage such work.
078         *
079         * <p>
080         * Notes for implementers: the method assumes people have already been
081         * baselined (see model builder sequencing). The try/catch around the
082         * transmission parameter inference provides a fast path for typical datasets
083         * while guarding against pathological cases where the quick routine fails.
084         *
085         * @param builder  builder used to assemble the
086         *                 {@link ImmutableOutbreakBaseline}
087         * @param outbreak the outbreak used to compute aggregates and calibration
088         * @param sampler  a sampler available for any stochastic choices during
089         *                 baselining
090         * @return a built {@link ImmutableOutbreakBaseline} containing global priors
091         *         and calibration values
092         */
093        default ImmutableOutbreakBaseline baselineOutbreak(
094                        ImmutableOutbreakBaseline.Builder builder, Outbreak outbreak,
095                        Sampler sampler
096        ) {
097                ExecutionConfiguration configuration = outbreak
098                                .getExecutionConfiguration();
099
100                // N.B. happens after people are baselined.., I think
101                double parameter;
102                try {
103                        parameter = Calibration.inferViralLoadTransmissionParameterQuick(
104                                        outbreak, configuration.getR0()
105                        );
106                } catch (Exception e) {
107                        parameter = Calibration.inferViralLoadTransmissionParameter(
108                                        outbreak, configuration.getR0()
109                        );
110                }
111                builder.setDefaultPolicyState(configuration.getDefaultPolicyModel())
112                                .setViralLoadTransmissibilityParameter(parameter)
113                                .setExpectedContactsPerPersonPerDay(
114                                                Calibration.contactsPerPersonPerDay(outbreak)
115                                )
116                                .setSeveritySymptomsCutoff(
117                                                configuration.getInHostConfiguration()
118                                                                .getSeveritySymptomsCutoff(outbreak, configuration)
119                                )
120                                .setSeverityHospitalisationCutoff(
121                                                configuration.getInHostConfiguration()
122                                                                .getSeverityHospitalisationCutoff(
123                                                                                outbreak, configuration
124                                                                )
125                                )
126                                .setSeverityDeathCutoff(
127                                                configuration.getInHostConfiguration()
128                                                                .getSeverityFatalityCutoff(outbreak, configuration)
129                                )
130                                .setInfectivityProfile(
131                                                InHostConfiguration.getInfectivityProfile(
132                                                                configuration, parameter, 100, 100
133                                                )
134                                ).setSymptomDuration(
135                                                configuration.getSeverityProfile().getQuantile(0.95)
136                                );
137                outbreak.getStateMachine().init(configuration.getDefaultPolicyModel());
138                return builder.build();
139        }
140
141}
